DataElement.preferredName: Tooth Temperature Dental Occlusion Pain Yes or No Response
DataElement.preferredDefinition: is an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar. The degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment. Interdigitation of the teeth. The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings. A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.
The spatial relation of the upper and lower teeth when the jaws are closed.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
